quality_assessment.rationale: Report demonstrates excellent structural completeness, consistent 9-field signal formatting, strong FSSF coverage (6/8 types), and rich cross-impact analysis. Minor deductions for STEEPs imbalance (no Environmental or spiritual signals) and H3 absence. pSST score distribution shows improved spread compared to prior runs but uses a different scale (7.80-9.35 on 10-point vs 77-93 on 100-point in prior runs).

nine_field_completeness.details: All 15 signals contain all 9 required fields (분류, 출처, 핵심 사실, 정량 지표, 영향도, 상세 설명, 추론, 이해관계자, 모니터링 지표). Each field has substantive content, not placeholder text. Average field word count is high, especially for 상세 설명 and 추론 fields.

steeps_balance.details: 4 of 6 STEEPs categories represented. Political (P) dominates at 40% (6 signals), Economic (E) at 26.7% (4 signals), Technological (T) at 20% (3 signals), Social (S) at 13.3% (2 signals). Environmental (E_env) and spiritual (s) are both absent (0%). Political dominance is explainable by current news cycle (martial law trials, North Korea, Trump tariffs) but represents a structural gap.
steeps_balance.observation: STEEPs coverage has declined from 6/6 (02-11) to 4/6 (02-13). While daily news availability explains variation, the complete absence of Environmental signals is notable given ongoing climate and sustainability news (e.g., Milano Olympics sustainability theme could have been tagged E_Environmental instead of S).

psst_score_distribution.details: pSST range: 7.80 to 9.35 (spread of 1.55 on 10-point scale). This is wider than prior runs which showed compression (e.g., 02-11: 77-93 on 100-point = 1.6 spread, 02-10: 82-91 on 100-point = 0.9 spread). The current run uses a different pSST scale (10-point vs 100-point in prior runs), which complicates direct comparison. Score ordering aligns well with impact assessment.
psst_score_distribution.score_compression_assessment: IMPROVED - The spread (1.55 points) provides meaningful differentiation between signals. The top signal (9.35) and bottom signal (7.80) are clearly distinguishable.
psst_score_distribution.scale_inconsistency_flag: WARNING: pSST scores use 10-point scale in this run vs 100-point scale in prior runs (02-10, 02-11, 02-12). This inconsistency prevents direct trend comparison and should be standardized.

fssf_coverage.details: 6 of 8 FSSF types represented. Missing: Megatrend and Discontinuity. Minimum 3 types required = PASS. Excellent distribution with Emerging Issue (4), Trend (3), Precursor Event (3), Weak Signal (2), Driver (2), Wild Card (1).
fssf_coverage.observation: FSSF coverage declined from 8/8 (02-11) to 6/8 (02-13). The absence of Discontinuity and Megatrend is notable. Some current signals could arguably qualify (e.g., Semicon Korea AI paradigm shift could be Discontinuity; AI semiconductor supercycle could be Megatrend).

three_horizons_distribution.details: H1 dominates at 80% (12 signals), H2 at 20% (3 signals), H3 at 0% (0 signals). The heavy H1 concentration reflects the current news cycle but limits strategic foresight value. Prior runs had better H3 representation.
three_horizons_distribution.observation: H3 (7yr+) signals are absent. This reduces the report's value for long-term foresight. Prior runs captured H3 signals (e.g., population crisis, nuclear arms, AI megatrends). Consider whether some H1-tagged signals (e.g., AI malware paradigm shift, autonomous lab) should be H2/H3.

format_compliance.details: 8 required sections present (exceeds minimum of 7). All 15 signal blocks detected with consistent formatting. No unfilled {{PLACEHOLDER}} tokens. Impact scale consistently uses X/10 format. Word count 9,159 (exceeds minimum 5,000). Cross-impact analysis present with 6 pairs (exceeds minimum 3). Section 5 has 5.1/5.2/5.3 subsections.

tipping_point_assessment.details: Tipping point analysis is comprehensive with 5 alert-level signals across 3 levels (ORANGE, YELLOW, GREEN). ORANGE alert for Trump tariff threat is well-justified with Critical Slowing Down indicator. YELLOW alerts include actionable indicators. All 15 signals have tipping_point data in the priority-ranked JSON.
tipping_point_assessment.observation: Alert distribution is reasonable. The single ORANGE for tariff threat is proportionate. No RED alerts is appropriate for current conditions.

W1_impact_scale_inconsistency.details: All impact scores consistently use X/10 format throughout the report. No instances of X/5 or +X.X format detected.

W2_psst_score_compression.details: pSST spread improved to 1.55 points (7.80-9.35) compared to prior compression (02-10: 0.9 spread on 100-point scale). However, a NEW issue has emerged: the pSST scale changed from 100-point (prior runs) to 10-point (this run) without clear documentation or conversion. This breaks trend comparability.
W2_psst_score_compression.recommendation: Standardize pSST scale across all runs. If using 10-point, ensure all historical data is consistently scaled.

W3_cross_workflow_analysis_formulaic.details: This is a WF3 standalone report. Cross-workflow analysis is performed at integration stage only.

W4_reasoning_field_depth.details: The '추론' (reasoning) field across all 15 signals shows substantial analytical depth. Signals include contrarian perspectives, cross-signal references (e.g., signal #1 references signal #4), conditional scenarios, and quantified probabilities. Average reasoning field length exceeds 150 words per signal.
W4_reasoning_field_depth.evidence: Signal #1 reasoning references tariff risk from signal #4 and discusses historical overheating patterns. Signal #7 references signal #9 for nuclear submarine link.

W5_steeps_category_imbalance.details: Only 4 of 6 STEEPs categories represented (down from 6/6 on 02-11). Environmental and spiritual categories are completely absent. Political dominance at 40% is the highest single-category concentration observed in WF3 history.

W6_unicode_arrow.details: Report uses proper arrow characters throughout. Found proper Unicode arrows (→, ↔) in cross-impact analysis section.

W7_signals_11_15_condensed.details: Signals 11-15 maintain full 9-field format with substantive content. No condensation or field omission detected. Signal 11 (AI SDL) and Signal 15 (prosecution cancellation) both have complete detailed analysis.
W7_signals_11_15_condensed.evidence: All signals 11-15 have 상세 설명 field exceeding 100 words each

W8_report_length_disparity.details: Report word count of 9,159 is well within expected range and demonstrates thorough coverage. No significant length anomaly.

area_1_threshold_tuning.reason: First SIE run for WF3. Minimum 3 prior SIE runs required before parameter tuning actions. Currently 0 prior SIE runs exist.
observations: Priority scoring weights (I40/P30/U20/N10) are consistent across runs and appear well-calibrated for the news domain.
The pSST scale inconsistency (10-point vs 100-point) should be resolved before any threshold tuning.
WF3 report generation completed successfully with full 15 signals and 8 sections.
Crawling statistics show 180 articles collected from 6 sections with S/N ratio of 8.3% (15/180), which is within normal bounds.
No execution errors or retries detected.
STEEPs classification quality: 4/6 categories covered. The absence of Environmental (E_env) signals is a classification concern, not necessarily a source availability issue.
FSSF classification: 6/8 types covered. Classification appears thoughtful (e.g., Wild Card for North Korea congress is well-justified by radical uncertainty).
Potential misclassification candidate: Signal #14 (Milano Olympics) tagged Social could arguably include Environmental component given sustainability focus.
pSST confidence levels are all in the 'confident' to 'very_high' range (7.80-9.35/10).

steeps_trend.observation: Environmental category coverage has declined across recent runs. 02-11 had E_Environmental signals; 02-13 does not. This may indicate a classification bias toward more 'newsworthy' categories (P, E_Economic, T) at the expense of Environmental signals.

observations: Scan window properly enforced: 2026-02-12 00:39 to 2026-02-13 00:39 KST (24 hours).
Report structure is complete with all 8 sections, including Naver-specific features (FSSF, Three Horizons, Tipping Point).
Signal database growth: 60 signals total (healthy accumulation for a system running since 02-06).
Signal IDs follow correct format: naver-20260213-TOP-NNN.
All 15 signals have verifiable source attributions with specific press outlets.
Quantitative data points (KOSPI 5,522.27, ETF $281M inflow, 668 med school slots, 110 officials investigated) are cross-referenced with multiple sources.
Tipping point indicators reference specific factual triggers.

area_6_source_exploration.reason: Source exploration is WF1-only feature. WF3 uses fixed Naver News sections. No source exploration analysis applicable.

parameter_tuning.reason: This is the first SIE run for WF3-Naver. Per safety configuration (min_workflow_history: 3), parameter tuning requires minimum 3 prior SIE cycles. Current count: 0.

future_candidates.observation: pSST scale inconsistency needs resolution first. Once standardized, weight calibration may improve signal differentiation.
Current weights (I40/P30/U20/N10) produce reasonable ranking but may over-emphasize impact for news-domain signals where urgency is inherently high.

immediate.title: Resolve pSST scale inconsistency
immediate.description: pSST scores in this run use 10-point scale (7.80-9.35) while prior runs (02-10, 02-11) use 100-point scale (77-93). This breaks comparability. Standardize to one scale across all WF3 runs.
immediate.action: Requires user decision on standard scale (10-point or 100-point)

immediate.title: Improve STEEPs coverage diversity
immediate.description: Environmental and spiritual categories absent. Coverage dropped from 6/6 (02-11) to 4/6 (02-13). Consider adding a STEEPs coverage check during Phase 2 classification that flags when fewer than 5/6 categories are represented.
immediate.action: Proposal for orchestrator classification step modification

immediate.title: Improve Three Horizons diversity
immediate.description: H3 (7yr+) signals are absent. H1 dominates at 80%. Prior runs achieved 13-20% H3 coverage. Consider explicit guidance to classify at least 1 signal per horizon.

future.title: Establish baseline metrics for SIE trend analysis
future.description: With this first SIE run, a baseline is established. After 3 consecutive SIE runs, threshold tuning can begin. Key metrics to track: STEEPs coverage ratio, FSSF type coverage ratio, pSST spread, H3 signal presence.
future.action: Continue SIE runs for data accumulation

trend_analysis.reason: First SIE run. Trends based on priority-ranked files only (not prior SIE analyses).

observations.signal_count_stability: Consistent 15 signals per run across all observed dates. Target maintained.
observations.fssf_diversity_trend: Declining from 8/8 types (02-11) to 7/8 (02-10) to 6/8 (02-13). Monitor for further decline.
observations.steeps_diversity_trend: Declining from 6/6 (02-11) to 5/6 (02-10) to 4/6 (02-13). Monitor for further decline.
observations.psst_scale_issue: Scale changed between runs, preventing meaningful score trend analysis.
observations.political_dominance_trend: P category signals: 02-10 had 3/15 (20%), 02-11 had 4/15 (27%), 02-13 had 6/15 (40%). Increasing political concentration may reflect news cycle but should be monitored.
observations.h3_signal_trend: H3 signals: 02-10 had 3 (20%), 02-11 had 2 (13.3%), 02-13 had 0 (0%). Clear declining trend in long-term foresight signals.

key_findings: Report quality is high (Grade A-) with excellent structural completeness and signal depth.
All 15 signals have complete 9-field formatting with substantive analytical content.
Known weaknesses W1 (impact scale), W6 (Unicode), W7 (signals 11-15) are RESOLVED.
W4 (reasoning depth) is IMPROVED with cross-signal referencing and contrarian analysis.
W5 (STEEPs imbalance) has REGRESSED -- only 4/6 categories covered (down from 6/6).
W2 (pSST compression) shows IMPROVED spread but introduces NEW issue: scale inconsistency (10-pt vs 100-pt).
Three Horizons: H3 absent (0%) -- strategic foresight gap.
Tipping Point alerts well-calibrated with 1 ORANGE, 4 YELLOW.
This is the FIRST SIE run for WF3 -- no parameter changes applied. Baseline established.
summary.next_action: Run SIE for at least 2 more consecutive WF3 scans to accumulate history for threshold tuning eligibility.
